title: Drawing, "Coat of arms of Pope Pius VI"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Upon a broad base rises a pedestal in the center, with the coat of arms of the pope in a wreath at the front. On top the keys and the tiara. At left, upon the base, sits a winged female genius, blowing the trumpet. At right is a sketch: two winged figures standing upon a base support a drapery and the two crossed keys. On top the tiara. Usual background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Coat of arms of Pope Pius VI".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1823.
